meanings.definition: A person or thing that civilizes.
meanings.sent1: The civilizer taught the children good manners.
meanings.sent2: The ancient philosopher was considered a great civilizer of society.
meanings.sent3: The little robot acted as a civilizer, teaching the aliens about human customs.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the magical wand was portrayed as a powerful civilizer of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder was seen as a gentle civilizer, guiding the community towards peace.

meanings.definition: To make more cultured or refined.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to civilize the wild animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The teacher worked hard to civilize her students' behavior.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy tried to civilize the grumpy troll with etiquette lessons.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to civilize the soul and bring harmony to the heart.
meanings.sent5: The kind words of the poet had a civilizing effect on the rough crowd.
